Patch to now utilize nominal character increment if glyph metric cannot be found

The nominal character increment specifies the most commonly repeated character increment for all characters in the font [1]. If a characters metric information is missing, this value can be used from the Font Orienation section to act as a default. At present, FOP defaults to a space character which potentially leads to problems with wrapping under certain circumstances. This patch adds support for this as a fallback if its value is set. If it isn't set and the metric information is missing, it will fallback to FOPs existing method and use a space.

[1] www.outputlinks.com/sites/AFP/ibm_foca_​focaref5.pdf
